work.p: A proof sheet of "Bravo, Paris Exposition!" with corrections in Whitman's hand.

notesStmt.note: This proof is likely from 1889, the year of the poem's publication.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Bravo, Paris Exposition!

lg.head: BRAVO, PARIS EXHIBITION! Exposition!
lg.l: Add to your show, dear before you close it, France,
With all the rest, visible, concrete, temple, towers, goods, machines and ores,
Our sentiment wafted from many million heart-throbs, ethereal but solid,
(We grand-sons and great-grand-sons do not forget your grand-sires,)
From fifty Nations and nebulous Nations, compacted, sent over-sea to-day,
America's applause, love. memories and good-will.
